@ Chook, the reason it's happening is because your Anti-Virus thinks "Paul.dll" (from the crack) is a virus and has probably either deleted or quarantined it.

Replace it, then add the file as an exception to your Anti-Virus so that it ignores it.

OK I'm seeding this game but. If I can't get it to work I'll stop seeding it. How to and what makes me get rid of the need for a key? My antivirus is off.

If it's asking you for a key, then it's not cracked properly.

If you're sure you're doing it OK, then it has to be your Anti-Virus.

Sometimes turning them off isn't enough, you have to add "Paul.dll" as an exception.

ok when you say "Paul.dll". is this somthing I should be able to find , because I don't see it anywhere?
Can someone just explain the procedure without skipping anything, because I think you are expecting me to know something.

"Paul.dll" is in the Trivium\Binaries folder on DVD2.

Most Anti-Virus see it as a threat, and usually quarantine or delete it.

That's what is happening to you, and why it's still asking you for a key.

Anyway, easiest way is to install the game, then copy the crack over.

EG Copy the entire contents of the Trivium folder from DVD2 to the game directory, and overwrite if asked.

Then add the entire Borderlands installation folder to your Anti-Virus as an exception so it will ignore it.

Once that's all done, it should work perfectly.

I have every file from the torent extracted, installed, and in the game directory. Even the dll. I'm trying to get past the Key entry window.

"EG:" is an abbreviation for "Example". 

Anyway, I'll try again.

You extract from ISO's from the rar files, they are named "TVM_BLGOTY1.iso" and "TVM_BLGOTY1.is2".

Then you mount the first DVD ISO "TVM_BLGOTY1.iso" in a virtual drive and install the game as you usually would.

When it asks you for DVD2, then un-mount the first DVD and mount the second "TVM_BLGOTY1.is2" so the installation finishes.

Once it has, then update the game with the 1.41 patch on the second DVD in the "Update 1.41" folder.

Then copy over the contents of the TRIVIUM folder "Binaries" "WillowGame" and "LanguageChanger.bat" over to where you have the game installed.

The default installation path is:

C:\Program Files (x86)\2K Games\Gearbox Software\Borderlands GOTY Edition

That's where you copy the crack files to.

When it asks you to overwrite, click Yes.

The game should now start and run.

BTW, if you don't know what a virtual drive is, then use Google for information.

Wicked download here, works like a charm once you figure out where everything goes, i can see why ppl are having trouble with this.
this is how i did it:-

1 - Mounted disc 1 with deamon tools and started the install.
2 - Mounted disc 2 when prompted.
3 - When the page about th serial comes up, just cancel it. (needs to be done 4 times, i guess for each DLC??) and th install will finish.
4 - with disc 2 still mounted, open it (explore) to find the trivium folder and 1.41 update.
5 - copy "paul dll" from th binaries folder inside the trivum folder to the game install folder.
6 - Install 1.41 update.

The main game should now work.

As for th DLC's....

Inside the trivium folder, is a willowgame folder that contains all th cracked DLC maps. to get the DLC's to work, you have to copy the cracked maps to th main install folder and overwrite. only then, will the dlcs work.

Hope this helps ease some of th confusionbecause this torrent is awesome.
